definition.en: A short explanation or note added to an Object.

usage.en: [UPDATED] In this context, typically a Dimension on a cable or pipe map, for example the distance of a cable to a facade. Can consist of parts (e.g. dimensioning line, dimensioning guideline, two arrows) that are also Annotations in themselves.

definition.en: The way an item looks.
Physical point-shaped part of the UtilityNetwork.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Can stand alone as a Utility Node, but is often mounted on a carrier (the Utility Node Container). E.g. an inspection hatch, a hydrant, a splitter, a meter, a pump etc.

definition.en: Simple Utility Node Container that takes the shape of a cabinet.

usage.en: Contains typically smaller mountable Appurtenances and Cables.

definition.en: A Utility Link Set used to transmit electricity or data from one location to another.
[UPDATED] Object that could potentially contain cables and/or pipes/ducts.

usage.en: [UPDATED] For example, if the object is a Pipe: a Pipe can include Cables or other Pipes. Analogous for pipes of the Duct type. Cables are not Cable and Pipe Containers. NOTE: whether the Cable and Pipe Container ultimately contains other elements is indicated by the outgoing relations to those other relations (e.g. Channel.pipe, Pipe.cable, Channel.cable, Pipe.pipe etc).

definition.en: Object describing the connection of a cable or pipe to a building or other physical object.
Vertical Position below the Reference Surface.
Type of Annotation that indicates the size of an Object.

usage.en: For example, the dimensions of a room.

definition.en: A Utility Link Set used to protect and route cables and pipes through an enclosing structure.

usage.en: A Duct (or Conduit, or Duct-bank, or Wireway) is a linear object which belongs to the structural network. It is the outermost casing. A Duct may contain Pipe(s), Cable(s) or other Duct(s).

definition.en: A Cable used to transport electricity from one location to another.
Vertical Position above the Reference Surface.
Simple Utility Node Container that takes the form of a covered opening in the road surface providing access to the subsurface.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. sewer cover.

definition.en: A pipe used to transport oil, gas or chemicals from one location to another.
[UPDATED] A Utility Link Set for transporting solids, liquids, chemicals or gases from one location to another.
Drawing showing the parts or details of something.

usage.en: [UPDATED] For example, in this context, an additional detail plan or, for example, a longitudinal profile.

definition.en: Simple Utility Node Container that takes the shape of a pole.

usage.en: Typical carrier of mountable Appurtenances and Cables.

definition.en: Area within which certain regulations apply when carrying out works.
Surface relative to which a position is measured.

usage.en: In this context typically the ground level.

definition.en: A sewer pipe used to convey wastewater (sewer) from one location to another.
A Utility Link or Link Sequence used to convey data signals (PSTN, radio or computer) from one location to another.
A pipe used to disseminate heating or cooling from one location to another.
Part of the description of the shape and features of the earth's surface.

usage.en: Typical elements are relief, landforms, water bodies, vegetation.

definition.en: Simple UtilityNodeContainer that takes the shape of a Tower.

usage.en: Typical carrier of mountable Appurtenances and Cables.

definition.en: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity between two points in a Utility Network.
An unbranched continuous path in the Utility Network.

usage.en: [UPDATED] In fact, a route in the network, for example a water pipe in the flow direction. Routes have a direction, which is why the Link Sequence is composed of Directed Links.

definition.en: An abstract utility network class which groups common properties of Cable, Pipe and Duct featureTypes.

usage.en: This class also extends the Link Set featureType, which allows Cable, Pipe and Duct classes to use either the (more complex) Link Sequence or (more simple) Link class.

definition.en: Collection of network elements of one type of utility service.

usage.en: [UPDATED] For example, an electricity network, a sewerage network, a gas network. The network elements in question are, for example, the elements of the network of an internet provider: optical cables arriving in cabinets on the street via multiplexers connected to copper cables to the homes in that street.

definition.en: Abstract base type representing an utility network element in an utility network. Every element in an utility network provides some function that is of interest in the utility network.

usage.en: [UPDATED] NOTE: is abstract, must be specialized (e.g. as Electricity Cable, Sewer, Manhole, Cabinet etc).

definition.en: Point-shaped spatial object that plays an important role in a Utility Network.

usage.en: Can stand alone or form beginning or end of a Utility Link. NOTE: is abstract, should be further specialised as Appurtenance or a subclass thereof.

definition.en: Point shaped Utility Network Element, potential carrier of Utility Nodes.

usage.en: Eg Tower, Pole, Manhole, Cabinet. Eg a Cabinet contains switches, connections etc that form Nodes in the Utility Network.

definition.en: Position in vertical direction relative to a Reference Surface.
A water pipe used to convey water from one location to another.
Type of water.
Way to alert for the presence of the Link Set.

usage.en: For example, an underground protective plate or net.
[UPDATED] E.g. depth.

definition.en: The time from which the Utility Network Element no longer exists in the real world.
The time when the Utility Network Element started to exist in the real world.
Way in which the utility is delivered.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. transport, distribution and collection from gas, electricity and sewage respectively.

definition.en: Heigt of the Tower.
The type of thermal product transported through the Thermal Pipe.
Text of the Annotation.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the size in the case of a Dimension.

definition.en: [UPDATED] Temperature of pipe contents.
Type of cable material.
Further specification of the Link Set.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. 4g10 used to specify a 4-core cable with a diameter of 10 mm.

definition.en: Default Vertical Position of elements in the network.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the default Depth at which the elements are located.

definition.en: Type of sewer water.
Angle by which the Annotation should be rotated when displayed.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Typically to align the Annotation with the Object it relates to, e.g. parallel to the cable.

definition.en: Reference to the Reference Surface.

usage.en: For example, the ground level.

definition.en: The maximum allowable operating pressure at which a product is transported through a Pipe.

usage.en: The unit of measurement for pressure is usually expressed in 'bar'.

definition.en: The height of the Pole.
Outer diameter of the Pipe.

usage.en: [UPDATED] For convex shaped objects (e.g. a circle) the diameter is defined to be the largest distance that can be formed between two opposite parallel lines tangent to its boundery.

definition.en: Voltage during load.
The type of oil, gas or chemical product transported through the oil, gas or chemical pipe.
Voltage without load.
Type of material that makes up the Link Set.
Utility Network to which the element belongs.
Utility Network to which the element belongs.
Utility Network to which the element belongs.
Utility Network to which the element belongs.
Element identifier.
Name by which the network is known.
Activities carried out by the complex.

usage.en: Possibly supplemented with information about inputs and outputs of the activities.

definition.en: Width of the Duct.

usage.en: The measurement of the object - in this case, the duct - from side to side.

definition.en: Reference to a Document containing additional information about the Network.
Reference to a Document with additional information about the complex.
The Vertical Position as distance from the Reference Surface.

usage.en: For example, the distance from ground level.

definition.en: Legal text describing confidentiality clauses applying to the utility network information.
Distance below the Reference Surface.
The status of the element with respect to its completion and use.
The color of the object.
Diameter of the Cable.
Parties authorized to manage, operate or own the Utility Network.
Object to which the Annotation refers.

usage.en: For example a cable.

definition.en: Address of the Connection.
The Positional Accuracy of the Survey.
The Vertical Position as a position in a vertical coordinate system.

usage.en: For example, in Belgium the z-coordinate in TAW.

definition.en: Extent to which the container is observable.
Indicates whether a Utility Node Container can be considered hazardous.
Angle by which to rotate the symbol representing the container on a map.
Appearance of the container.

usage.en: For example the color.

definition.en: Extent to which the Node is observable.

usage.en: For example, not visible above ground.

definition.en: Indicates whether the Node can be considered hazardous.
Angle by which the symbol representing the Node on map should be rotated.
Appearance of the Node.

usage.en: For example the color.

definition.en: General indication of the Vertical Position of the element.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. underground, above ground.

definition.en: Extent to which the Link Set is observable.

usage.en: For example, not visible above ground.

definition.en: Indicates whether the Link Set can be considered hazardous.
Appearance of the Link Set.
Agent who carried out the Survey.
Type of the method used.
The Vertical Position of the ReferenceSurface as position in a vertical coordinate system.

usage.en: Typical the groundlevel.

definition.en: Classification of the Pipe according to the thematic domain to which it belongs.
Type of the Pipe as a container.
Type of the Duct as a container.
Appurtenance classification.
Classification of a cable, pipe, or pipe elements according to the thematic domain to which they belong.
Type of Appurtenance.
Distance between two points on a curve.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Used here to describe the size of something, for example the height of a tower.

definition.en: A measured amount of a certain quantity, expressed in some unit.
Degree to which a specified position represents the actual position.

usage.en: For example, expressed as the maximum deviation in cm between both positions.

definition.en: Someone or something that can act or produce an effect.
A 1-dimensional geometric primitive.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Dimension is to be understood in a mathematical sense: the minimum number of coordinates needed to represent any point that is part of the primitive. In the coordinate system formed by a Curve itself, 1 coordinate suffices to locate a point on the Curve, e.g. the distance along the Curve from the starting point. A Curve has a length but no width or height, which does not prevent it from meandering through 3D space. Curves are usually represented by polylines, which are sets of successive points where the intermediate points of the Curve are obtained by interpolation. If the interpolation method is linear you get a Linestring (an angular line connecting successive points by a straight line), other ways of interpolating result in circular arcs, cubic splines, BÃ©zier curves etc (where the control points are not necessarily on the Curve). A Curve is bounded by its starting and ending points.

definition.en: A 0-dimensional geometric primitive.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Dimension is to be understood in a mathematical sense: the minimum number of coordinates needed to represent any point that is part of the primitive. In the coordinate system formed by a Point itself, no coordinate is needed, as there is only 1 point. A Point therefore has no width, length or depth. ATTENTION: this does not mean that a Point cannot have coordinates in another coordinate system, e.g. xyz-coordinates in and 3-axis orthogonal coordinate system.

definition.en: Kind of container.
To what extent the object is observable.
The nature of the risk.
Color of the element.
The kind of material used.
Classification of a cable, pipe, or pipe elements according to the thematic domain to which they belong.
Classification of utility network types.
The state of the facility component.
Classification of utility network types.
Classification of warning types.
Kind of material the telecommunication cable is made of.
Classification of oil, gas or chemicals.

label.en: Oil Gas Chemicals Product Type Value

definition.en: Nature of sewage.
Kind of water.
Classification of thermal product.
TO DO
Appurtenance classification.
Classification of economic activity.
The value of inputs and outputs.
Kind of annotation.
Classification of the topographic element.
Document mediatype.
Kind of document.
The kind of reference surface.
The way the measurement result was determined.
Classification of protected area.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.

usage.en: The starting point here is that this string is assigned by an organisation and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

definition.en: More readable representation containing only the basic data of the address,intended for using an address as an attribute of another object.

usage.en: Eg as attribute ve person or building. The address representation does not only refer to Belgian addresses, it can be used to represent foreign addresses (where address designations other than house number or bus number may be used or where address components such as address areas occur).

definition.en: Shape and position characteristics of an object.

usage.en: Describes these features through points, lines, polygons and coordinates.

definition.en: Entity from which all entities are derived.
Indication of a geographical position, by means of coordinates, a toponym, an address label, a reference to a place/region, an address or another geographical object.
Information recorded on a data carrier.
Indication of a quantity.

usage.en: NOTE: Substitute for the primitive data types that can be used to represent a quantity. See xsd data types Integer, Float, Decimal, Double etc.

definition.en: Information that allows to refer in a structured and unique way to a building unit,a berth,a pitch or a plot based on a municipal name,a street name,a house number and possibly a bus number and a postal code.

usage.en: [UPDATED] The definition refers to Belgian addresses. In other countries, an address may refer to other geographical objects (not a building unit or a plot of land) or consist of other designations (different from house number and bus number) or of other components than street name, town name or postal code. Alternative address designations than house number or bus number (e.g. entrance designation, stair designation, floor designation) or a building name or room name etc are possible through an association with address extension. Exchange of foreign addresses must be done with the object address representation.

definition.en: Technical and economic unit managed by the same operator where certain activities regarding production and services take place.

usage.en: [UPDATED] In practice, a site, plot, facility, installation, building where the activity takes place. In the context of cables and pipes, it refers to e.g. a power plant, a pumping station, a sewage treatment plant, etc. Includes the infrastructure, equipment and material required for it. May include several sites as long as they are part of the same complex. The activity is preferably identified by NACE codes.

definition.en: Holder of the coordinates of a position in a coordinate reference system.

usage.en: [UPDATED] Typically used to describe the geometry of a spatial object or the geometric primitives (e.g. point, line, plane.) that compose that object. However, a DirectPosition can also stand alone to describe a position in space. The position is given in a coordinate reference system. That reference system is explicitly specified with the DirectPosition, unless it is part of a spatial object (eg a geometric primitive) where a reference system is already stated. FYI: A coordinate reference system differs from an indirect spatial reference system in that positions are specified directly by coordinates instead of indirectly by an address or place name.

definition.en: The function of something expressed as an activity and optional input and/or output.
Determining the exact size of something by measuring it.
A link either in its positive or negative direction.
Linear Network Element.
Curvilinear network element that connects two positions and represents a homogeneous path in the Network. The connected positions are represented by Nodes.
Unbranched continuous path in a Network.

usage.en: For example, a route in the Network.

definition.en: Collection of Link Sequences and/or Links with a specific function or interest in the Network.
Collection of Network Elements.

usage.en: [UPDATED] The reason why the Network Elements are brought together in a Network may differ, for example because they are suitable for a certain type of transport.

definition.en: Significant position in the Network that always coincides with the beginning or end of a Link.
Annotation of which the Annotation is a part.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the Dimension to which the dimension line belongs.

definition.en: Annotation that is part of the Annotation.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the dimension line in the case of a Dimension, consisting of two arrows and a dimension guide line.

definition.en: Utility Network Element belonging to the complex.
Utility Node that is contained by the Utility Node Container.
Utility Network associated with the Utility Network.
Utility Network Element belonging to the network.
Activity Complex belonging to the network.
Utility Network to which the element belongs.
Other Pipe located in the Pipe.
Cable located in the Pipe.
Pipe located in the Duct.
Duct located in the Duct.
Cable located in the Duct.
Node that is the end of the Link.
Link of which this Node is the end Node.
Indicates if the Directed Link agrees (positive) or disagrees (negative) with the positive direction of the Link.
Node that starts the Link.
Link of which this Node is the start Node.
Geometry of the Node.
Geometry of the container.
Utility Link Sequence or Utility Link that is part of the Link Set.
Directed Link that is part of the Link Sequence.
The geometry of the centerline of the Link.
Reference to the Link.
Output the result of the activity in the function.
Input for the activity in the function.
Classification of the activity.

usage.en: Preferably use the NACE codes.

definition.en: The way the geometry was determined.
The way the position was determined.
Utility Network to which the Activity Complex belongs.
Address from which the address representation is derived.

usage.en: This can only be done for Belgian addresses as address means a Belgian address.

definition.en: Municipal name from address.
Country in which the address is located.
Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, moorings, pitches or plots.

usage.en: Specialization of Address representation: location indication for Belgian addresses.

definition.en: Officially assigned alphanumeric code added to the house number to distinguish multiple building units, pitches, moorings or plots that have the same house number.

usage.en: Specialisation of Address Presentation:location indication for Belgian addresses.

definition.en: The height of the Appurtenance.
Distance above the Reference Surface.
Location of the Protected Area.
Street name of address.
Name denoting the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Code denoting the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
PO Box number in a post office.
Name or description of the geographic object the address locator designates.
Alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the address locator within the street, administrative unit, etc.
Location for which the Vertical Position applies.

usage.en: Typically the xy-coordinates of a Point on the earth's surface for which the Vertical Position of the Reference Surface applies. Or the Geometry of (part of) the Reference Surface.

definition.en: Geometry of the Annotation.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the location and shape of a Dimension.

definition.en: Shape and position features of an object,

usage.en: Typical elements are relief, landforms, water bodies, vegetation.

definition.en: Location of the Reference Surface.

usage.en: Typically the xy-coordinates of a Point on the earth's surface for which the Vertical Position of the Reference Surface applies. Or the Geometry of (part of) the Reference Surface.

definition.en: Geometry of the site covered by the Plan.
Geometry of the complex to describe its location and size.
Geometry of the Protected Area.
The complete address in one string, formatted or not.

usage.en: Avoids errors when splitting an address into its components. Displays the prescribed order of the different parts.

definition.en: The region of address, usually a province or state or similar area that typically includes several places.
Highest Administrative Unit of the address, usually a country.
Name of a geographic area or place that groups a number of addressable objects to address them without the area or place being an administrative unit.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. the name of the hamlet in which the address is located.

definition.en: The place where the Document is stored or can be consulted.
Name from the agent who assigned the identifier.
External Identifier of the complex.

usage.en: NOTE  An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

definition.en: Identifier of the Document.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: Type of the string refers to the identifier (incl its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

definition.en: Geometry expressed in wkt format.

usage.en: Use wktliteral as datatype.

definition.en: Direct Position expressed in wkt format.

usage.en: Use wktliteral as datatype.

definition.en: Geometry expressed in gml format.

usage.en: Use gmlliteral as datatype.

definition.en: Direct Position expressed in gml format.

usage.en: Use gmlliteral as datatype.

definition.en: Name by which the complex is known.

usage.en:
NOTE 1 Several names in different languages may be expressed.
NOTE 2 It is recommended that the language of the name (part of the Geographical/Name data type) be filled whenever possible.

definition.en: Time the identifier was assigned.
Link to the agent who assigned the identifier.
The type of utility network or the utility network theme.

usage.en: Uses the Utility Network Type code list to describe the possible utility networks. This also includes the 'crossTheme' value to be used for utility networks that may contain cables or pipes from different themes, typically used by utility network providers that supply pipes.

definition.en: The type of Reference Surface.

usage.en: Typical the groundlevel.

definition.en: Classification of different types of protected areas.
Type of the Topographical Element.
Classification of the document.
Classification of the Annotation.

usage.en: [UPDATED] In this context, typically a Dimension on a cable or pipe map, for example the distance of a cable to a facade. Can consist of parts (e.g. dimensioning line, dimensioning guideline, two arrows) that are also Annotations in themselves.

definition.en: Name of the Protected Area.
Object to which the document refers.
Reference to a Document containing additional information about the element.
Nature of the data carrier on which the Document is stored.
Description of the Document.
A more detailed description of the function.
Description of the Protected Area.
The moment at which the Survey took place.
Unit identifier.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. m for meter.

definition.en: The amount.
Unit in which the quantity is expressed.
Unit in which the Length is expressed.

usage.en: [UPDATED] E.g. meters, centimeters.
